column1: The Goops are all dirty, and what do they do?
column2: They like to be dirty, and stay so.
column3: But if _you_ were dirty, you'd wash, wouldn't you?
column4: If you needed a bath, you would say so!
column5: [Illustration] [Illustration: Neatness] _NEATNESS_   Goops leave traces everywhere--   Gum stuck underneath the chair,   Muddy footprints in the hall,   Show that Goops have been to call;   Shoes and stockings on the floor   Show where Goops have been before!
column6: [Illustration] [Illustration: Courtesy] _COURTESY_   I wonder why it is polite   In shaking hands, to give your _right_.
column7: I wonder why it is refined   In passing one, to go _behind_.
column8: I wonder why it is well-bred,   If you must sneeze, to turn your head.
column9: Perhaps the reason is because   The Goops, they never have such laws!
column10: [Illustration] [Illustration: Generosity] _GENEROSITY_   When you have candy, do you go     And give your sister half?
column11: When little brother stubs his toe,     Do you look on and laugh?
column12: The greediest Goop would give away     The things he didn't need--   To share the toys with which you play,     That's generous, indeed!
column13: [Illustration] [Illustration: Consideration] _CONSIDERATION_   When you're old, and get to be   Thirty-four or forty-three,   Don't you hope that you will see     Children all respect you?
column14: Will they, without being told,   Wait on you, when you are old,   Or be heedless, selfish, cold?
column16: [Illustration] [Illustration: Miss Manners] _MISS MANNERS_   No matter how you wish   For the last one on the dish,   Miss Manners has a right to it, not you;   And the largest one of all,   Or the nicest, big or small--   Well, I think you'd better leave her _that_ one too!
column17: [Illustration] [Illustration: Borrowing] _BORROWING_   Whose doll is that on the table?
column18: Whose book is that on the chair?
column19: The knife and the pencils and other utensils,     Now how do they come to be there?
column20: Didn't you say they were borrowed?
column21: You'd better take back just a few!
column22: If _you_ lent your playthings, I think you would say things     If no one returned them to you!
column23: [Illustration] [Illustration: Memory] _MEMORY_   My teacher taught me, yesterday,   A very pretty piece to say;   But when I try to think of it,   I can't remember it a bit!
column24: My head's so full of toys and such,   I can't remember very much!
column25: My teacher told me yesterday   "_Work when you work; Play when you play!_"   When I am playing with my toys   I am the busiest of boys;   But when I study or I work   I'm 'fraid I _am_ inclined to shirk!
column26: [Illustration] [Illustration: Books] _BOOKS_   I have a notion     The Books on the shelves   Are just as much persons     As we are, ourselves.
column27: When you are older,     You'll find this is true;   You'd better be careful     To make Books like you!
column28: [Illustration] [Illustration: Honesty] _HONESTY_   The boy who plays at marbles and doesn't try to cheat,   Who always keeps his temper, no matter if he's beat,   Is sure to be a favorite with all upon the street.
column29: The girl who counts her hundreds very fairly, when she's "it"   Who doesn't peep or listen, nor turn around a bit,   I'm sure she's not a Goop, in fact, she's quite the opposite!
column31: "_WHY?_"   Josephus never yet was heard   To say but just one single word!
column32: When father said to go to bed,   Then "_Why?_" was all Josephus said.
column33: When mother bade him stop his play,   Then "_Why?_" Josephus used to say.
column34: He always made the same reply.
column36: [Illustration] [Illustration: Bed-Time] _BED-TIME_   The night is different from the day--   It's darker in the night;   How can you ever hope to play   When it's no longer light?
column37: When bed-time comes, it's time for you   To stop, for when you're yawning,   You should be dreaming what you'll do   When it's to-morrow morning.
column38: [Illustration] [Illustration: Modesty] _MODESTY_   The proper time for you to show   Whatever little tricks you know   Is when grown people ask you to;   _Then_ you may show what you can do!
column39: But sometimes mother's head will ache   With all the jolly noise you make,   And sometimes other people, too,   Can't spend the time to play with you!
column40: [Illustration] [Illustration: Disfiguration] _DISFIGURATION_       Have you ever seen the scrawls       On the fences and the walls,   All the horrid little pictures and the horrid little names?
column41: Don't you think it is a shame?
column42: Are the Goops the ones to blame?
column43: Did you ever catch them playing at their horrid little games?
column44: [Illustration] [Illustration: Bravery] _BRAVERY_       It's terrible brave       To try to save   A girl on a runaway horse;   You could do that, of course!
column45: But think of trying       To keep from crying,   When you're hungry and tired and cross--   You couldn't do _that_, of course!
column46: [Illustration] [Illustration: Tidiness] _TIDINESS_   Little scraps of paper,     Little crumbs of food,   Make a room untidy,     Everywhere they're strewed.
column47: Do you sharpen pencils,     Ever, on the floor?
column48: What becomes of orange-peels     And your apple-core?
column49: Can you blame your mother     If she looks severe.
column50: When she says, "It looks to me   As if the Goops were here"?
column51: [Illustration] [Illustration: Patience] _PATIENCE_   The clock will go slow   If you watch it, you know;     You must work right along and forget it.
column52: So study your best   Till it's time for a rest,     The clock will go fast, if you let it!
column53: [Illustration] [Illustration: Fortitude] _FORTITUDE_   When you have been a naughty child,     Or taken more than was your share,   When you've been sulky, cross or wild,     You must not say, "Oh, I don't care!"
column54: But when you hate to see it rain,     And when it's time to comb your hair,   And when you have a little pain,     _Then_ you can say, "Oh, I don't care!"
column55: [Illustration] [Illustration: George Adolphus] _GEORGE ADOLPHUS_   Oh, think what George Adolphus did!
column57: He went where mother had forbid,     And said he "_didn't care!_"   Oh, think what George Adolphus did!
column59: The children whoop "You are a Goop!
column62: [Illustration] [Illustration: Politeness] _POLITENESS_   I think it would be lots of fun   To be polite to every one;   A boy would doff his little hat,   A girl would curtsey, just like that!
column63: And both would use such words as these:   "_Excuse me, Sir_," and "_If you please_;"   Not only just at home, you know,   But everywhere that they should go.
column64: [Illustration] [Illustration: Gentleness] _GENTLENESS_   When you are playing with the girls,   You must not pull their pretty curls;   If you are gentle when you play,   You will be glad of it some day.
column65: [Illustration] [Illustration: Hospitality] _HOSPITALITY_   When a person visits you, remember he's your guest,   Receive him very kindly, and be sure he has the best;   Make him very comfortable and show him all your toys,   And only play the games you're very sure that he enjoys.
column66: When you pay a visit, never grumble or complain,   Try to be so affable they'll want you there again;   Don't forget the older ones, your hostess least of all,   When you're leaving tell her you have had a pleasant call!
column67: [Illustration] [Illustration: Pets] _PETS_   Almost every Goop forgets   When it's time to feed his pets,     'Cause his memory fails;     Listen to his wails!
column68: He is often scratched or bitten   By the puppy or the kitten,     'Cause he pulls their tails!
column69: [Illustration] [Illustration: Remember] _REMEMBER_   Remember not to suck your thumb;     Remember not to slam the door;   Remember when the callers come     To take your toys from off the floor.
column70: [Illustration] [Illustration: Curiosity] _CURIOSITY_   I think that it would help you much   If you'd remember _not to touch_.
column71: The Goops do this, and they do more,   They peep and listen at the door!
column72: They open bottles of cologne,   And feel of parcels not their own!
column73: But there are many stupid folks   Who do not care for children's jokes.
column75: Willy spilled the ink,   Willy left the water-pipe     Running in the sink!
column79: Willy, he owned up to it,     And didn't tell a lie!
column80: Willy told his mother     Before she found it out   _He_ said: "I am so sorry!"
column82: [Illustration] [Illustration: Clothes] _CLOTHES_   When you are playing in the dirt,   You should wear clothes you cannot hurt;   It will not matter, when they're worn,   If they are just a _little_ torn.
column83: But when you're really nicely dressed,   Be careful of your Sunday Best!
column84: You must not crawl upon your knees;   Be careful of your elbows, please!
column85: [Illustration] [Illustration: Helpfulness] _HELPFULNESS_   I never knew a Goop to help his mother,   I never knew a Goop to help his dad,   And they never do a thing for one another;   They are actually, absolutely bad!
column86: If you ask a Goop to go and post a letter,   Or to run upon an errand, _how_ they act!
column87: But somehow I imagine you are better,   And you _try_ to go, and _cry_ to go, in fact!
column91: for your mother is ill.     Hush!
column92: for the baby     Is sleeping, and may be   He'll catch a nice dream if you're still.
column93: Kiss me, and promise you will!
column94: [Illustration] [Illustration: Order] _ORDER_   Make your soldiers march away,   When you're finished with your play.
column95: Lead them to the barrack-box,   Make them carry all your blocks.
column96: Teach your doll to go to bed,   Not to lie about instead;   Tell her she must clear away   Everything she's used to-day.
column97: All your playthings and your toys   Must be trained like girls and boys!
column98: [Illustration] [Illustration: Teasing] _TEASING_   Tease to linger longer when your mother bids you go;   Tease to have a penny when your father answers, "No!"
column99: Tease to have a story when your uncle doesn't please;   That's the way to be a Goop--_tease, tease, tease!_   Hint about the carriage when there's only room for three;   Hint about the toys you like and every doll you see;   Hint about the candy, say you're fond of peppermint;   That's the way to be a Goop--_hint, hint, hint!_ [Illustration] [Illustration: Interruption] _INTERRUPTION_   Don't interrupt your father when he's telling funny jokes;   Don't interrupt your mother when she's entertaining folks;   Don't interrupt the visitors when they have come to call,--   In fact, it's generally wiser not to interrupt at all.
column100: [Illustration] [Illustration: Cry-Baby] _CRY-BABY_   I'm sure that I would rather die   Than have my playmates see me cry;       It twists your face       And knots your forehead,   And makes you look all cross and horrid;   And every one who sees you cries   "What _is_ the matter with your eyes?"
column101: [Illustration] [Illustration: Caution] _CAUTION_   When you travel in the street,   Are you cautious and discreet?
column102: Do you look about for horses   When your little brother crosses?
column103: Do you go the shortest way,   Never stopping once to play?
